Present a remote system using Learning Tools Interoperability (LTI) standard (returned score allowed).

wb:helpBody.g:HTML:
Modifying this text box will change the text of the title that is presented with this application in the Gift Authoring Tool when authoring adaptive courseflow objects.
This is used to help distinguish between different practice applications of the same type in the list of practice applications.

b:Tooltip.title: The VBS menu/window is manipulated (e.g. load the scenario)
A real time assessment log is played, the VBS application is not used.
The VBS menu/window is NOT manipulated

wb:helpBody.g:HTML:
The VBS scenario name is used by GIFT to help automatically start the VBS scenario for this part of the course.
The scenario name must match the name of the VBS scenario as show in the various VBS menus such as the Mission Editor's Load Mission and the Networking Host Server setup.
If VBS can't find a match to the scenario name, the GIFT course will end prematurely.

wb:ManagedTooltip.title: Click to remove the selected domain session log file
Click to change the selected scenario from the log file

g:FlowPanel.g:InlineHTML: Play audio file when the log playback starts (Optional)

wb:helpBody.g:HTML:
When a domain session log is played back during course execution, an audio file can optionally be played alongside it.
This can be useful for providing a playback of the sounds heard while the log was captured.

wb:ManagedTooltip.title: Click to remove the selected audio file
Change how GIFT manages the Gateway connection(s) and any logic related to managing a VBS scenario.

g:FlowPanel.g:Label: The information given to Unity before starting the assessment (SIMAN Load message).

g:FlowPanel.g:HTMLPanel:
Note: We recommend viewing Unity content in Firefox, Chrome, or Edge since these browsers are
well-supported by Unity.
You may want to suggest to your learners which browsers they should use for the best learning experience.

wb:helpBody.g:HTML:
This is a generic way to provide input when loading the training application.
The load arguments defined here will be sent to the application's window embedded in the Tutoring interface when the course begins running the appropriate training appplication.
These arguments can be used to configure or or excecute logic in the training application.
Accepted argument key names and values generally vary from training application to training application; so for training applications that aren't recognized by this editor, argument key names and values must be entered manually.
In order to author these fields, you will need to know how the training application will use them.

g:Image.title: Click here to create and add a new argument.

wb:helpBody.g:HTML:
This is a generic way to provide input when loading the training application (i.e. loading a scenario).
The load arguments defined here will be sent to the Gateway module when the course begins running the appropriate training appplication.
These arguments can be used to configure or or excecute logic in the interop interface used to run the training application.
Accepted argument key names and values generally vary from training application to training application; so for training applications that aren't recognized by this editor, argument key names and values must be entered manually.
In order to author these fields, you will need to know how GIFT and the training application will use them.

g:Image.title: Click here to create and add a new argument.
